title: How to Learn Key Phrases in Kurdish

steps.title: Below are some greetings.
steps.content: Below are some greetings. [2] X Research source Say Hello : Slaw! , Dem Baş!/ Silav/ Silam/choni/dam bash Say How are you: Chonî? / Tu başî?/ Xasîd?, Xweşîd?/Chakid? Say I'm fine: Çakim , Xasim/ başim/ Xasim/bashm Say Thank you: Supas/ Spas/ Spas/dast xosh Say Yes: balê /arê / Erî Say No: Ne / Na/ Ne/naxer Say I : Mn / Ez/ Me Say You(singular): To / Tu/ To Say He/She: Aw/ Ewe/ Ewe, Üwe Say We : Éme / Em/ Éme Say You(Plural): Éwe / Hun/ Éwe Say They: Ewan Say Good morning: Beyanî baş/ spêde baş/ Şewekî Xweş Say Good Afternoon: Nîwerro baş/ Say Good Evening: Éwar baş /Evar baş/ Éware Xweş Say Good Night: Şew baş/ Şev baş/ Şew Xweş/shaw shahd Say Goodbye: Xwa-legell(Xwa= God / Legell= With) in other words God be with you./ Mal Ava/ Binîşîte Xweş

steps.title: Goodnight:
steps.content: Goodnight: Şew Baş /Şev baş/ Şew Xweş [3] X Research source

steps.title: please:
steps.content: please: Tkaye/ Tika dikim [4] X Research source

steps.title: do you love me:
steps.content: do you love me: To minit xoş dawêt?/ Tu hez ji min dikî?

steps.title: I Love You:
steps.content: I Love You: Min Tom Xoş Dawêt/ Ez hez ji te dikim [5] X Research source

steps.title: Come here!
steps.content: Come here! : Were bo êre!/ were vêrê! [6] X Research source

steps.title: Say my name is....:
steps.content: Say my name is....: Nawî min .... e./ Navê min....e/nawm....

steps.title: Where are you going?:
steps.content: Where are you going?: Bo kwe erroy?/ Tu kîve diçî?

steps.title: what are you doing?
steps.content: what are you doing? :To çî dekey? To xerîkî çît?/ Tu çi diki?

steps.title: I'm going to work :
steps.content: I'm going to work : Eçim bo ser kar/eacm bo eish

steps.title: When are you coming back?
steps.content: When are you coming back? /when are you turning around? : Key degerrîtewe? / Key dêytewe?/ Tu dê kengî vegerî?

steps.title: I'm coming back :
steps.content: I'm coming back : Xerîkim dêmewe., Ewe hatmewe./ ez zivrim/ Le pisa tîyemew.

steps.title: What's your job?
steps.content: What's your job? : Karî to çî ye?/ Karê te çîye?

steps.title: Thank you very much:
steps.content: Thank you very much: Zor supas/ Gelek spas/zor supas bo tu

steps.title: I am going:
steps.content: I am going: Min errom, Min demewê birrom./ Ezê çim.

steps.title: I'm not ok :
steps.content: I'm not ok : Min baş nîm/ Ez ne başim/ Me Xwes Nîyim

steps.title: I'm sick:
steps.content: I'm sick: Min Nexoşim./ Ez nexweşim.

steps.title: What is it?
steps.content: What is it? : (Ewe) çî ye?/ Eve çîye?/ Ewe çes?

steps.title: You love me:
steps.content: You love me: To minit xoş ewê/ tu hez ji min di keyi./ Tu le min xweşit tîyeêd.

steps.title: I love you:
steps.content: I love you: Min tom xoş dewê/ ez hez ji te dikem/ Min le tu xweşim tîyeêd.

steps.title: I miss you:
steps.content: I miss you: Bîrit ekem/ min bîrya te kirye/ Hürit kirdime

steps.title: Are you coming back?
steps.content: Are you coming back? : Dêytewe?, Degerêytewe?/ tu ye bi zivri?/ tîyeêdew?, Gerrêdew?

steps.title: I'm not coming back :
steps.content: I'm not coming back : Nayemewe, Nagerrêmewe/ ez na zivrim/ Nyetîyemew, Nyegerrêmew

steps.title: Below are the days of the week.
steps.content: Below are the days of the week. SUNDAY: Yekşemme/ êkşemb i/ Yekşeme MONDAY: Dûşemme/ duşemb / Dişeme TUESDAY:Seşemme/ sêşemb/ Sêşeme WEDNESDAY: Çuwarşemme/ carşemb/ Çwarşeme THURSDAY: Pêncşemme/ pêncşemb/ Pêncşeme FRIDAY: Cúmha/ Heynî/ Cume SATURDAY: Şemme / Şemî/ Şeme
